DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer Treatment Questionnaire Some Treatments Are Better Than Others At Stopping Prostate Cancer True False Unsure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A true, false, or unsure response indicator to whether some treatments are better than others at stopping prostate cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Cancer Treatment Questionnaire Some Treatments Are Better Than Others At Stopping Prostate Cancer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the prostate gland.  The vast majority are carcinomas._A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the prostate gland.  The vast majority are carcinomas._At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A unit of area equal to 100 square meters. Are is a non-SI unit accepted for use with SI._In an improved condition._No Value Exists_Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Used to indicate position, location, or state._Put an end to a state or an activity.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the prostate gland.  The vast majority are carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A unit of area equal to 100 square meters. Are is a non-SI unit accepted for use with SI.
Occurring at a time in the near future.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
Put an end to a state or an activity.
A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the prostate gland.  The vast majority are carcinomas.
